1.t: He frowned and then turned away

2.t: from a blind man who had come up to him.

3.t: You never know. Perhaps he wanted to purify himself,

4.t: or receive some (Quranic) advice which would benefit him.

7.t: though you will not be questioned even if he never purifies himself.

8.t: As for the one who comes to you earnestly (striving for guidance).

9.t: and who has fear of God,

12.t: so let those who want to follow its guidance do so.

13.t: (This Quran) is also recorded in honorable books,

15.t: by the hands of the noble, virtuous,

17.t: May (the disbelieving) human being be condemned! What makes him disbelieve?

18.t: From what has God created him?

19.t: He created him from a living germ. He determined his fate

20.t: and made the path of guidance easy for him to follow.

21.t: Then He caused him to die and be buried

22.t: and He will resurrect him whenever He wants.

23.t: Certainly, he has not duly fulfilled His commands.

24.t: Let the human being think about (how We produce) his food.

26.t: and let the earth to break open

32.t: (These are made so as to be) means of enjoyment for you and your cattle.

34.t: it will be such a day when a person will run away from his brother,

37.t: for on that day everyone will be completely engrossed in his own concerns.
37.tr: Likul limri-im minhum yawmaa-izin shaa-nuy yughneeh

38.t: Some faces on that day will be radiant,

42.t: These will be the faces of the sinful disbelievers.
